title: MOVHLPS — Move Packed Single-Precision Floating-Point Values High to Low

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`MOVHLPS xmm1, xmm2`
`VMOVHLPS xmm1, xmm2, xmm3`
`VMOVHLPS xmm1, xmm2, xmm3`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: This instruction cannot be used for memory to register moves.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Moves two packed single-precision floating-point values from the high quadword of the second XMM argument (second operand) to the low quadword of the first XMM register (first argument). The quadword at bits 127:64 of the destination operand is left unchanged. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register remain unchanged.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Moves two packed single-precision floating-point values from the high quadword of the third XMM argument (third operand) to the low quadword of the destination (first operand). Copies the high quadword from the second XMM argument (second operand) to the high quadword of the destination (first operand). Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: If VMOVHLPS is encoded with VEX.L or EVEX.L’L= 1, an attempt to execute the instruction encoded with VEX.L or EVEX.L’L= 1 will cause an #UD exception.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
